title: In Israel, a couple trapped in their marriage by ultra-Orthodox rabbis
description: The Ashkelon rabbinical court has refused to grant their divorce until the wife agrees to an investigation proving her Jewishness, and demands that the Supreme Court recognize its jurisdiction in the matter.

title: Anti-terrorism operation in Belgium targets 'staunch supporters of the Islamic State'
description: The federal prosecutor's office announced the arrest of seven individuals, 'almost all' of Chechen origin, who had been trying to obtain weapons.  Judicial officials suspect them of planning an attack against an institution.

title: Britannia's nostalgia: England still quarrels over its imperial past
description: Challenged by new historiography interested in the shadowy areas of British colonization, the United Kingdom is going through a memorial crisis around its imperial past, which it has never really stopped revering.

title: How 200 tangled worms untangle themselves in a split second
description: US researchers have been trying to explain how worms manage to tangle up to protect themselves from heat or cold and untangle themselves extremely quickly in response to an attack.

title: King Charles III's coronation, in pictures
description: King Charles III and Queen Camilla were crowned on Saturday at Westminster Abbey in London in a solemn ceremony. Thousands of onlookers flocked to the British capital, and several anti-monarchist activists were arrested.

title: Electric cars: France reaches milestone of 100,000 charge points
description: France now ranks second in Europe in terms of the number of public charge points, behind the Netherlands and ahead of Germany. The goal is to quadruple the number of charge points to 400,000 by 2030.

title: Sudan: In Khartoum, 'the bodies are rotting in the streets'
description: Since April 15, the clashes have left more than 700 people dead and 5,000 wounded, according to a committee of doctors, while the flow of humanitarian aid has been slow.

title: Three and a half years of Covid-19: What are the collateral effects?
description: Due to a massive influx of infected patients, the pandemic resulted in massive cancellations of surgeries, and delays in both diagnosis and management of chronic and acute diseases.

title: The political art behind eyeliner
description: Eyeliner, used since antiquity, conquered the planet, highlighting the most beautiful eyes in the history of film.

title: War in Ukraine: Wagner group asks to hand Bakhmut positions to Chechen fighters
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the paramilitary group, has asked for his men to be replaced on the front line in the Ukrainian town of Bakhmut, accusing the Russian military of supplying too little ammunition.

title: At Budapest conference, Orban draws only second-string far-right leaders
description: The Hungarian prime minister's guests at a CPAC event attacked what they called 'woke ideology' and 'LGBT propaganda,' and avoided talking about the war in Ukraine.

title: Greek train tragedy: Families of victims hold new protests
description: The February 28 collision between two trains took the lives of 57 people. Their relatives want justice.

title: Russian nationalist writer Zakhar Prilepin injured in car 'explosion'
description: The Russian interior ministry said one other person was also killed in the explosion in the Nizhny Novgorod region. Russia blamed Ukraine and the West.

title: Philippines rescues over 1,000 victims of trafficking
description: In a raid north of Manila, the Philippine police rescued over a thousand people, many of whom are foreign, who were often used to promote fake crypto investments.

title: King Charles coronation: UK police criticized for arresting anti-monarchy protesters
description: Six members from the anti-monarchy group Republic were arrested hours before the ceremony. Human Rights Watch called the arrests 'incredibly alarming.'

title: China wants to turn the page on Covid-19
description: Now that most restrictions have been lifted, the government is boasting about its handling of the pandemic. But it is still continuing to filter and censor information on the origin of the virus.

title: UK: Sunak's Tories suffer serious setbacks in local elections
description: According to near-complete results, the Conservatives lost over 1,000 local councilor seats in Thursday's election in England. Labour and the Liberal Democrats benefited from this decline, one year ahead of the 2024 general election.

title: Philippe Sollers, novelist, critic and essayist, has died
description: The French writer, who wrote 'A Strange Solitude,' founded two successful journals and was the heart of Paris' intellectual scene in the 1960s and 70s, died at the age of 86 on May 6.

title: King Charles III's coronation live: Vegan oil, fewer carriages and a recycled crown for a modernized ceremony
description: King Charles III, who was heir to the British throne for 70 years, is finally being crowned on May 6, at the age of 74. Follow the day's events as they unfold on Le Monde in English's liveblog and watch a live stream of the ceremony. All times Paris time (GMT +2).

title: Coronation of king Charles III: An ancient tradition put to test by a multicultural and secular society
description: The religious ceremony is scheduled for Saturday in Westminster Abbey. For the first time, women bishops will take part in the liturgy, and the coronation regalia will be carried by people who reflect the diversity of the UK.

title: Hugh Grosvenor, the young duke richer than the king
description: With a fortune estimated at £10 billion, the 7th Duke of Westminster, who is 32 years old, will hold a prominent position during the coronation ceremony of his godfather, Charles III.

title: ChatGPT: Why the Web is not about to be flooded with content created by generative AI
description: From message boards to product reviews and social media, some fear an 'invasion' of participative spaces by generative artificial intelligence. Yet the reality is more nuanced.

title: India is acting as a hub for Russian oil
description: The Western embargo enables New Delhi to purchase crude oil from Moscow at low prices, and sell refined products at market prices.

title: Messi says 'sorry' to PSG for Saudi trip that caused him to be suspended
description: The football star was suspended after failing to turn up for training on Monday after traveling to Saudi Arabia without permission to fulfill commitments as part of a contract with the country's tourist office.

title: Sudan’s warring sides send envoys for talks in Saudi Arabia
description: The negotiations would be the first between Sudan’s military and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces since clashes broke out.

title: Giorgia Meloni pushes out the French director of the Naples Opera, Stéphane Lissner
description: A decree setting the retirement age for foreign directors of opera houses at 70 targets the former director of the Opéra National de Paris and the director of Milan's La Scala.
